page.title: 15Valley Road Primary School
page.content: Valley Road Primary school, Henley-on- Thames was built in 1970. It was built for 200 children. The school was built in this area because lots of houses were being built around this area. At first the school had eight teachers. Before the school was built, there were fields. The school is mainly built of bricks, glass and wood. It has had two head teachers since, Mrs. Nisbet and Mrs. Ruffell. There were two terepin buildings. John Humphries, Nick Spargo and H.E.Todd have visited the school which is open plan in design.
